The man then says "I got something to say to you too. When you get knocked down. Don't give up. Just train yourself and try again. That's what my mom always told me."

The man then says "That's a nice name. The name is Rob." The woman then says "And I'm Mindy." Amber then says "I'm Amber."

Rob then says "I hope we fight again one day. I'd like to see what kind of pokemon trainer you become." Mindy then says "And I would like to see how much you raise that Eevee."

Once he finished speaking Zach started to leave as fast as he could barely saying thanks for the Pokémon. You and the girl patently thank oak and then walk out of his lab.

1113.content:
Okay, picture this. You're a kid living a simple life in a small town off the westernmost coast of the Kanto region. While it may not look like much, this small town isn't as a grand as Saffron's tallest buildings or Vermilion City's gorgeous ports, but it still holds significance. For one, it is home to one of Kanto's proudest residents and revered champion the world over. His name is...Samuel Oak.

This powerful ball of charisma used to be a champion of Kanto's Elite 4 Branch, but as a devoted educator, he retired from his position and went on to the studying of human and pokemon interaction. He went on to become a Professor as a profession. Don't believe me? Well, as much as I would love to go on and on and exploit an engaging backstory, this is a story about a trainer who wants to follow in his foosteps. Actually, two! This is our story.

First, there's me. My name is Jack Ashton, one of the professor's prized student. As a human being, I am inspired to make my mark on the world and become famous. Then there's his grandson, Gareth Oak, the self-proclaimed prodigy of the Oak family. We were friends at one time, but as we got older, Gary became cocky and arrogant, pulling supremacy over me, taunting my less than interesting lifestyle. Knowing he did it in good fun, we became competitive rivals ever since. And today of all days, is the day we both are given a starter Pokemon under the guidance of the good professor.

Walking out of my room, I told my mom I was heading to the lab, to which she responds, "Of course! All boys leave home someday. It said so on TV. PROF. OAK next door was looking for you!" At this point, I thought she was reading that out of a card. Anyways, I head to his house, until his granddaughter, the gorgeous Daisy Oak, points me to the open field leading out of Pallet Town, where I saw the Professor block the road. He walks up to me, warning me of wild Pokemon before leading me back to the lab.

We head inside when Gareth greeted me, "Well, if it isn't Jack? Gramps, you're finally here!" before turning to his grandfather, "I was fed up with waiting! Where were you?"

Ignoring his grandson's question, the Professor congratulates us as diplomats before reaching the table. He turned to us, saying, "Here, boys! There are three Pokemon here! They are held inside these Poke Balls." At this point, he summarizes his entire life before permitting us to take any Pokemon we want!

"Heh! I already know which one I want. I'll let Jack pick first!" Gary retorts. Without missing a beat, I approached the desk with the 3 Poke Balls. These Pokemon are so cool! But, which one should I choose as my starter? First, there's Bulbasaur. He's a great supporter and a strong grass type. Not many trainers start off with them. Then there's Squirtle. A sturdy tank and a great water type. Finally, there's Charmander. He's quite popular with newcomers, bearing power and searing fire type moves. They're so cool, but I don't know which...

"...Just pick a Pokemon already!" Gary and the professor snap. Finally out of my stupor like a drooling Mankey, I decided to choose...
1113.title: My Name is Jack Ashton

11132.content:
"...Just pick a Pokemon already!" Me and gramps snap in sync. Honestly, what was going on in his mind? After coming out of his stupor like a drooling Mankey, Jack approached Squir...tle? What?! I bid my rage inwardly, not showing any signs of aggression. How could he choose the Pokemon I want? Either way, it was my turn after showing courtesy to my lesser rival.

Choosing my starter would've been hard hadn't Jack sto...taken my targeted choice. But I didn't waste any time choosing Bulbasaur. "I'll take this Pokemon, then." As Jack was leaving, I want to up and challenge him right then and there, but I waited until we were outside to proclaim, "Wait, Jack! Let's check out our Pokemon! Come on! I'll take you on!"

Our first battle was less than eventful, our Pokemon just colliding back and forth like Unovan football players. I think most of the townsfolk were cheering me on. Jack was having the upper hand, his Squirtle wagging its taunting tail to ire Bulbasaur. I shouted Bulbasaur not to attack, allowing Squirtle an opening offensive. I flinched. Me and my big mouth. But just as we were clinging to the edge of the match, something unexpected happened. Through sheer tenacity, Bulbasaur learned Leech Seed. Launching the seedling against Squirtle's hard shell, stems of vines grew rapidly, wrapping itself against Squirtle's body. As Bulbasaur regain some of its health, we went in for a finishing blow, claiming victory of our first rival battle.

As much as I wanted to jump with excitement, I kept myself grounded. I had a lot of work to do with Bulbasaur before we could engage in future Pokemon battles. "Okay! I'll make my Pokemon battle more to toughen it up. Jack! Gramps! Smell you later!" I didn't know where that come from, but I hope that doesn't become a running gag.

Passing through Kanto Route 01, I arrived in Viridian City in less than an hour...actually, four hours if you were ambushed by a pack of wild Mankeys. Just after getting my Bulbasaur fixed in the Pokemon Center from all that wild Pokemon battling, I stopped by the Poke Mart to buy some Poke Balls, but as I checked my backpack, I realized that I had forgotten my trainer's allowance back home. Shoot! I knew I was gonna need to travel back to Pallet Town anyways, waste of my time, but I wanted to pick up something grandpa had ask me earlier.

I asked the receptionist of my grandpa's delivery, until he exclaims that he didn't have it. "What? What do you mean you don't have it?!" The receptionist flinched at my retort, before exclaiming that someone had already taken it! Was Jack here? I hurried back to the open field before I saw a wild Primeape wreaking havoc around town. Seeing a pack of wild bruised Mankeys behind it left me with a pang of guilt for these people, but as I approached, a battalion of trainers approached the thrashing beast. They looked like they had it all under control, giving me enough time to get back home, but...
11132.title: Jack Chooses You, Squirtle?

111321.content:
"Viridian City faces a major crisis as a raging Primeape thrashes about. Citizens are sheltering in their homes, as more than a dozen trainers are attempting to tame the wild beast. The local police has evacuated most of the denizens off the streets..." Watching the Kanto News Network covering these attacks was too much for the old professor, and yet, he couldn't turn off his TV after seeing his grandson among the group of trainers. But it wasn't his grandson's appearance that had drawn his attention, as the Bulbasaur he had raised from an egg has grown quite strong.

"Uhm..." The professor blinked, turning to meet Jack's view.

"Oh, Jack! How is my old Pokemon?" Jack nudged Squirtle forward, the Pokemon greeting the good professor with a smile. "Well, it seems to be growing more attached to you. You must be skilled as a Pokemon trainer." Jack grinned happily, before fidgeting with his backpack, taking out an important package. "What's that? You have something for me?" Jack hands the delivered package to the professor. "Ah! It's the custom Poke Ball I ordered. Thank you!"

Before he opened the package, the door opens. "Gramps!" Professor Oak and Jack turn to the voice. "Gramps, my Pokemon has grown stronger! Check it out!"

"I know! I saw your feat on TV. And what good timing! I needed to ask both of you to do something for me." Professor Oak led us to his work desk, two handhelds laying there. "On the desk here are my invention, PC Tech approved, the Pokedex. It is a portable device that records data on Pokemon you've seen or caught. It's a high tech encyclopedia." He turns to us. "During my youth, I wanted to make a complete guide on all the Pokemon in the world. It was my dream. But back then, we didn't have these devices. And I've reached the age I can't get the job done. As my personal students, I want you two to fulfill my dream. Jack and Gary. Take these with you!" Professor Oak hands them the Pokedex. Gary and Jack respond in gratitude. "You two are among the first trainers to use these devices. This is a great undertaking in Pokemon history. So get going, you two! Your adventure starts now!" Gary and Jack jump with victorious ecstasy.

"Also, be sure to stop by the Poke Mart to buy Poke Balls. You can't get fully detailed data on Pokemon by just seeing them. You must catch them to obtain individual data. I'd have given you two Poke Balls, but..." The Professor nervously finished, both trainers deadpanning at his remark.

"Hmm, noted! Alright, gramps. Leave it all to me." Jack double-takes at Gary's remarks. "Heh! No need to get all hot, Jack. You won't be necessary for this, given your attention span. Besides, you'll get lost in the big bad world."

Jack turned away, frowning, "You're right! I'll just borrow a map from your sister!" After that sass, Jack makes a mad dash for the door, with Gary right behind him.

As both boys leave the lab behind them, Professor Oak giggled to himself, sighing in reminisce, "Jack Ashton, my faithful student. Always headstrong with a kind heart. I've watched him grow to a fine lad, but he is quite naive, less attentive. Sometimes he can be a bit careless. I can only imagine his path won't be easy, but it will lead him to great friends along the way. And Gary, my grandson. You're quite smart, tenacious and brave, but sometimes, you can be too cocky for your own good. You're never one to back down from a fight, always striving to win. It's no wonder you want to live up to our family name. But what keeps me connected to them, it's their rivalry."

Professor Oak began to recap their relationship, "Jack has always resented Gary's popularity in town, always striving for the same level of respect. Not just from the world, but from Gary as well. And Gary resents how much Jack is stronger than him, never giving his rival the recognition he oh so desires. The depth of the drama these two bear against one another can be a blessing, but it can also be dangerous! How will they fare? How will the world record their journeys, struggles and views on the path to victory?"
111321.title: On The Road to Victory!

1313.content:
Author's Note: The following paragraphs recaps the ending of the Mystery Dungeon: Rescue series. If you have never played the game, and don't want any spoilers, click the next chapter below!

I felt my body lifted beyond the heavens to the stars above, as I looked back down to an unnamed world, inhabited solely by Pokemon. With my mission coming to a close, I felt the suppressing urge to neglect ascension back to the planet and Pokemon I call home. I could only gaze as the planet shrunk out of sight, crestfallen, recapping the events that have led to this.

---------------
I found the urge to open my eyes, vision blurring to meet the light and the Pokemon around me. “...regaining consciousness!” I hear a familiar voice, as the Pokemon in the town square sigh with relief.

“Hey, did all of us make it?” Riolu’s voice reached his teammates, wrought with worry. He meets my gaze, my eyes half open, while a weakened Chikorita struggles to keep his balance. As our team huddle.

“Awesome, they’re alive! Team Gauntlet is alive!” Loudred exclaimed. Everybody gathered around us, each Pokemon praising our efforts in saving the world from a falling meteor the size of a moon. Eventually, I broke free of the binding population, only to follow the voice of a silhouette to the edge of the town, where Gardevoir awaits me.

“Cyndaquil…” She spoke in her usual melodic voice, “Thanks to your efforts, peace has returned to this world. We own everything to you and your friends.” She pauses for a second before asking, “...but you know now that your role has ended, don’t you?” I look away from her eyes, crestfallen. I have to leave the world and the Pokemon I had come to call friends. Fighting the urge not to cry, I nodded in response. “World building falls into their hands now. Soon, you must return to your world. You still have time to bid farewell.”

“I...can’t! I just can’t!” I retort in response, wanting nothing more than to spare their feelings.

“If that is what you want, I won’t stop you.” Gardevoir fades away. My body shimmers, as it gradually becomes lighter, no longer tied to the ground beneath my feet. I could feel my own being caressed in the wind’s embrace before I heard a voice behind me speaking.

“Hey, Cyndaquil.” Chikorita and Riolu call out, the ladder with the first response, “Snubbull is getting a party started to celebrate our success…” They gasp, surprised of my shimmering body.

“C-Cyndaquil!”

“Y...Your body! What’s happening to you?!” Chikorita chimes with fright before I could speak. I could only down, depressed that they see me like this. I have to explain things.

I brought my head up to their eye levels before speaking, “Rii...Cheeks! I’m sorry. I have to leave you now! I’m going back...back to the human world...where I belong.” Sadness reach their surprised gasps. I could swear Riolu turned away to cry his eyes out. “Please...don’t tell everyone about this. I don’t…” I struggled to speak, trembling with my voice, “I don’t want them to worry!” Chikorita’s whine breaks me in tears, but it was his hug that stung me into audible bawls. I whisper my apologies before my body ascended, caressed by the wind’s embrace. Our saddened eyes met, before my soul skyrockets into the heavens.

---------------
I struggled to voice out any rebellion. All I can of now is the people back in the world I once knew. I materialised in full, expecting to be a full fleshed human. Sadly, that was not the case when I saw my reflection. Assessing my situation, I find myself not in a town or a city, but in an open field of grass filled with Pokemon. Before I motion my body to move, I hear a rustle in grass. It was a...
1313.title: Mystery Dungeon: Rescuers...Alternate Ending!

Now before I we get this story on the road, there are a few things you should know about my family. At least half of us have some sort of ability that was passed down from a ansesstor, my brother and I were no exeption, apparently my sister was thou. Anyway, I'm a fairly unique case, because Ihave a power that no one in our family has ever had before, an unusually high ability to manipulate my aura. Add that with the color and most poeple shun within a few minutes of meeting me. My brother was fast, I'm not talking the flash fast, but inhumanly fast, know what I mean? I doen't want to bore you any more with myself, so I'm going to ask you 1 question...

Are you coming along or not?
1512.title: Zachary (Zack) Martin

15121.content:
Monday July 8th, 7:30 AM, Sandgem Town(Before we start, a little contest. Who ever can guess who my sister is first will get 500 Gps. Read carefully, you never know when a clue may be given. Good luck to all!!!)
____________________________________________________________________________ ___________________________________________________ (Derek's POV)

I was eating my breakfast in the kitchen, when my dad leaned in and asked if I could go and wake up Zack, my older brother. My jaw dropped at that question. "Are you insane!? Do you know what he'll do to me if I wake him up this early? I like to piss him off yeah, but I know my boundaries. One of which is never wake him up early, especially on his birthday."

Dad just shrugged and turned away. "I know just tell him that I sent you and to meet me in my office after he eats breakfast. Oh, tell Zeke, and Luke too, please."

"Fine." I said as I rolled my eyes and finished my breakfast. I put my dishes in the dishes washer and headed up to my brothers room, which was conveniently decorated with "Do not disturb" and "Keep out" signs. I was about to open the door when a voice behind me scared the ever living hell out of me.

"Derek, what the hell are you doing?" The voice said. I turned around quickly and saw a Shiny Zoroark behind me and giving a questioning expression. His name was Zeke. He came here as a shiny Zoroa with my mom when she moved to Sinnoh from the Unova region. By the time I was born, he had already evolved into the beast he is today and he had already become great friends with Zack and Luke, our Lucario. He can speak English, because mom taught him after he evolved.

"God dammit Zeke! You know I hate it when you do that." I said angrily.

He smirked then answered with and amused tone in his voice. "I know, That's why I love doing it. Anyway, you didn't answer my question. Why were you about to go into Zack's room?"

"Oh, that. Dad wanted me to wake up Zack so he could she him in his office after breakfast. He wanted to see you and Luke too."

"Why don't you let me tell him then? He won't want to rip me in half if I wake him up. You on the other hand..." He cringed "I not so sure."

"Go ahead, I didn't even want to wake him up in the first place." I said as I speed down stairs and into the living room in a matter of seconds. Then I plop down and turn on some cartoons.

-(POV change to Zeke)-

'Never stops amazing me how fast that kid can move. Aw well, better wake them up.' Now when I say 'them' I mean Zack and Luke. They share Zack's room and his bed. They practically do everything together. So it wasn't that surprising when they started sharing the bed. I opened to door and walked in. Zack's room was average sized with dark blue walls and black furniture. He had a large flat screen on the right wall across from his bed with an Xbox 360 and PS3 in an entertainment center underneath. There was a desk with a computer on the far wall and a dresser next to it. I looked at the bed and saw Zack, and Luke sleeping peacefully. I grinned widely. 'Oh, this will be fun'. I walk up to the bed and lean down over Zack and place my mouth near his ear. "Oh Zack... It's time to WAKE UP!!!!" I yelled as he sprang up startled. Luke was a different case, he just opened his eyes and gave me a death glare. Zack looked around frantically as if unsure where he was. When he saw me he looked at the clock on the side of the bed then flopped back down in the bed.

"Dude, it is waay to early to be waking me up. 9 o'clock minimum. Now go away and leave me alone to sleep." He rolled over away from me and snuggled into Luke a bit, which I found absolutely adorable, and tried to go back to sleep. Luke, still giving me a death glare, nodded in agreement, closed his eyes and unconsciously, at least in my mind, wrapped an arm around Zack and pulled him a bit closer.

"Sorry bud, wish I could but it's time to get up." I grabbed his shoulders and dragged him up and out of bed, placing him before me. He groaned in protest but walked over to his dresser and got dressed. the end result was a red t-shirt, black jeans, his black and white running shoes, and the cross his Ex had given him before he moved away. He then went over to the bed and and got Luke to get up as well. He was one of the few people that could.

"So, why in the hell did you wake me up this early in the morning?" He asked slightly irritated.

"According to your brother, who was about to wake you up himself, Your dad wants to see you, me and Luke in his office when your done eating breakfast. Oh and Happy Birthday." I said.

"K, thanks Zeke." He said as he scratched me behind the ears and walked out.

"Why does Mark want to talk to us, do you know?" Luke asked as he stood beside me.

"No clue what so ever. Aw well, we're going to find out soon right?" I said as I walked out followed by Luke.
15121.title: The begining

151211.content:
-(Zeke's)-
We walked downstairs and into the kitchen to be meet with a strange sight fir mist but a rather familiar one for ones in our house, Zack was sitting at the barcounter of the counter with his Iphone in one hand texting (probably to his friends Rebecca and Chris) and his otger hand was enfulfed @n black with tendrels running out pf the black and making him his breakfast. Absentmindily, we walked over and grabbed some pokefood and sat on either side of him. He smiled and gave us both a pat on the head and started eating hus own breakfast that had just been brought over by the tendrils. After we finished eating, we put our dishes away before going back upstairs to Mark's study. Zack knocked on the door once and walked in. Mark wasat his desk doing some paper work for something or other. When we walked in he looked up and gave us a smile.

"There you are! I was wondering when you boys were goung to get here." He said

"Yeah yeah. So, why did you want to see us?" Zack asked with a slight cock of the head. Mark smiled a bit wider and pulled open a drawr on his desk and he pulled out two items. One was a brand new backpack and the other was little machine of some sort, and when Zack saw it his eyes lit up and a huge smile broke across his face "Really?"

"Yep, go get packed bud, you are foing on a journey. And you two,"He he turned to me and Luke" are going with him." All our faces lit up and we sped out of the room followed by the hearty laugh of Zacks dad.
151211.title: Continue

1512111.content:
Sighing happily to himself, Zack smiled and leaned back a bit, getting a semi-pleasurable pop from his back. He looked back down at his now stuffed backpack, filled with anything he could need and still room for anything new. Next to it was his favorite coat and the poké's pokéballs. He quickly pocketed the balls and put on his coat, shouldering his back pack. Zack left his room after giving it one last look over and closed the door. He paused for a moment and just let it all sink in. He was finally going on a journey! Not just that, but with his two best friends since, like, forever! He was pulled out of his thoughts by a paw on his shoulder, causing him to jump. "Holy!" *he looked over and found Luke giving him a look of concern.

"Are you alright Zack?" he asked. "You looked like you spaced out there."

"Oh, yeah I'm fine bud. I'm just letting it all sink in." When he saw Luke cock his head in the way that meant he was confused, he continued. "I mean, I'm finally going on a journey. And not only that but with you AND Zeke." He smile and ruffled Luke's head fur a bit, before walking downstairs to be greeted by his family.

His mother, Jen, a short women, but only a few inches shorter then him, with bright yellow blonde hair and green eyes. She was a part time nurse at the local human hospital, it helps that her "inherit power" was being able to access any wound and know exactly what to do to heal it. She refuses to become a full time doctor to be home with the family. She is kind hearted and understanding (which is why she was the one he went to first to tell that he was Gay)

His father, a tall man with an average build. He has paler skin and brown hair that started to grey at the ends, but the most startling feature was the pair of bright gold eyes that danced with joy and playfulness. He worked as the head of a local home supply warehouse, anything needs to build or furnish a house could be found there. He works at home most days but has to go the warehouse occasionally to check up on things personally. He himself was also an exception like Zack older sister, not having an inherit power. He was fun loving and out going, always looking for something fun to do.

Finally, his little brother. He was a tall kid for his age, tanner skin from mom and brown hair from dad. His eyes were green as well, but a darker almost evergreen. He was mischievous and annoying, but he knew his limits. Zack smiled at his family as he reached the foot of the stairs and put down his bag. He walked over and hugged his mother tightly, who happily returned it. "I'm so happy that you can finally go on your journey, it's all you ever talked about! Now you can go and fulfill your dream bud." She smiled and kissed his cheek "But I'm gonna miss you. It's going to be a bit harder to make the meals without a few extra "hands" to help out in the kitchen." They laughed and Zack turned to his father. He had on his usual smile as he held out a hand. When Zack grasped it he was pulled into a hug with a few added back slaps.

"You'll do great out there kid! I'll be sure to watch your battles when you enter any tournaments or when you win the league!" He laughed as he embraced his grinning son. Zack thanked him and turned to look down at his little brother. He was a mix of happily and sad shooting across his face at the same time. Zack smiled and they preformed their secret handshake and ruffling his hair.

"I know it will be hard, but try to stay out of trouble will you? We won't be here to pull your ass out of the fire if you get in trouble ok?" Zack asked as he his brother huffed and nodded. Zack chuckled as he looked over his shoulder to see Zeke smiling as he leaned against the door frame to the living room. He stood up and his eyes shined for a moment as he made himself look like an older teen, lean and toned with nicely tanned skin and golden eyes. His hair was long purple toned , the occasional rustic red steak here and there tied at the end with a bright gold bead. He wore mostly grey clothes with his jacket shoulders matching the color of his "highlights" while his nails were painted to match his hair. He walked over and explained the transformation.

"Less attention will be drawn by this form then by a shiny Zoroark in Sinnoh." He chuckled and went to stand by the door with Luke, after grabbing a duffle bag from Zack's dad, later explained to be a tent for three and sleeping bags. Zack walked over with them and turned back to the family with a broad grin. He gave everyone one last hug, even his little brother who immediately returned it, clinging onto him a bit. He chuckled and pat his head he gave his mom and hug and a kiss on the cheek. He went over to his dad and gave him a firm hand shake, his father's eyes shining with pride as he went over and took up his bag again from Luke, who had grabbed it on the way by. He did one last look over of all his stuff and smiled, saying his final goodbyes and walked out with his partners. He stopped at the end of his yard and looked back, remembering all that had gone on in the house and adjusted his bag and they headed down the road, heading for prof. Rowan's lab to get his badge case. He looked up into the sky as they walked, thinking of all the things that could happen during their journey. He then looked back down and between that two Pokémon at his sides. He grinned and wrapped an arm around both of them and pulling them close to them as they laughed.

This was going to be the start of a great adventure

info.brief_description: Make a story about a trainer's journey and maybe a little more...
info.description: This is basically a pokemon story about your trainer and his journey and the way it works is that you place the setting in any region but your only allowed to use the pokemon of that region unless otherwise. I hope to see stories of adventure and romance from you amazing minds full of stories! I find that some people need to let go of limitations and today, I'm going to do just that so I'll allow the use of other pokemon from other regions but if you plan to do that, you should explain a little history behind how the trainer and the pokemon met. It's not a requirement but it would be nice so think about it. Anyways, as professor oak says "Welcome to the world of pokemon!"
